newsitem.title: USA: North Sea Brent slips in late U.S. paper markets.
newsitem.headline: North Sea Brent slips in late U.S. paper markets.

text.p: North Sea Brent crude barrels fetched weaker prices late Thursday in U.S. aftermarket dealings, traders said.
July Brent declined around 10 cents in extremely thin volumes. Partial cargoes traded for 100 lots at $20.10, eight cents weaker than the IPE settlement at $20.18 a barrel.
Other deals were seen for July Brent paper at $20.09 for a total of 200 lots in two separate trades, 200 lots moved at $20.07 and 150 more at $20.08.
The grand total for outright deals amounted to 650 lots in six deals, and featured a Wall Street trader selling most of the crude to a U.S. refiner.
An inter-month spread deal for a full cargo moved in June/July at plus seven cents, a shade stronger than markings earlier in London.
